Administration.text:
Type:
Proton pump inhibitor
(PPI)
Dosage Forms: Tablets or capsules of 10, 20, 40, 80mg. Powder of omeprazole sodium for IV.
Routes of Administration: PO, IV
Common Trade Names: Prilosec

GERD.text: 20mg PO once daily, taken about 1 hour before meals
20mg PO once daily, taken about 1 hour before meals

GERD_2.text:
<1 year: Safety and efficacy not established
5-10 kg: 5 mg PO qDay
10-20 kg: 10 mg PO qDay
>20 kg: 20 mg PO qDay

Erosive_Esophagitis.text:
<1 month: Safety and efficacy not established
Aged 1 month to <1 year
3 to <5 kg: 2.5 mg qDay
5 to <10 kg: 5 mg qDay
≥10 kg: 10 mg qDay
Aged 1-16 years
5 to <10 kg: 5 mg PO qDay
10 to <20 kg: 10 mg PO qDay
≥20 kg: 20 mg PO qDay

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: May be present in milk

Serious.text:
Agranulocytosis
Fractures, osteoporosis-related
Hepatotoxicity
Pancreatitis
Interstitial nephritis
Rhabdomyolysis

Common.text:
Headache, dizziness
Nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, flatulence, acid regurgitation, constipation
URI, cough
Rash
Gastric polyps
Alopecia
Atrophic gastritis

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 1-1.2 hours
[1]
Metabolism: Hepatic (CYP2C19, CYP3A4)
[2]
Excretion: Urine

Mechanism_of_Action.text: PPI; binds to H+/K+-exchanging ATPase (proton pump) in gastric parietal cells, resulting in suppression of basal and stimulated acid secretion
